meanings.definition: Give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher empowers the students to make decisions in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: Education empowers individuals to pursue their dreams and goals.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot empowers the pirate to have conversations with someone on the ship.
meanings.sent4: Kindness empowers people to create a ripple effect of positivity in the world.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape empowers him to fly through the sky and save the day.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) stronger and more confident, especially in controlling their life and claiming their rights.
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise empowers the athlete to perform better in competitions.
meanings.sent2: Supportive friends empower individuals to overcome challenges and obstacles.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a lucky charm empowers the student to believe in their abilities during exams.
meanings.sent4: Music empowers the soul to express emotions that words cannot capture.
meanings.sent5: The wise advice from her grandmother empowers her to face life's uncertainties with courage.
